S.FORM: prajing ta matas do, mtmay ruwan ptasan ka mtgsa,rmngaw ka mdudul, “Hiyug! Thmuku!”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: Paru hnang nami rmngaw, “mtgsa, embiyax su hug.”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: Matas siida o, tmgsa mnan sspug kari Truku ka mtgsa.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Truku language of numbers.

S.FORM: Smnegul nami mtgsa smpug, muyas nami uyas sspug.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: Smluhay ku lala bi ka kari ta Truku.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Truku languages.

S.FORM: Musa ku matas kdjiyax, smluhay ku kari ta Truku kdjiyax, rrngaw mu ni pqbhangun mu bubu.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Truku language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: Ubus ka hangan mu.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Ubus。
My name is Ubus.

S.FORM: Asing ka hangan tama mu.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Asing。
My dad’s name is Asing.

S.FORM: Ipay ka hangan bubu mu.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Ipay。
My mother’s name is Ipay.

S.FORM: Maxal hngkwasan ka hngkawas mu sayang.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: Niqan kingal qbsuran mu snaw, hangan na o Yudaw, maxal kingal hngkwasan ka hngkawas na sayang.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Yudaw，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Yudaw, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: Seupu nami matas kingal tgbilaq ptasan.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: Smkuxul muyas ka dha nami qbsuran mu snaw.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: Smkuxul ku tmapaq qsiya yayung, msangay siida o, mseupu nami musa tmapaq qsiya yayung ka kana ruwan sapah mu.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: Smkuxul ku mklaan bgurah lupung, saw kiya o, mtduwa nami mseupu muyas ni tmapaq qsiya yayung.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: Laqi ku seejiq Truku ka yaku, ga mniq Bsngan ka sapah nami.
S.TRANSL: 我是太魯閣族的小孩。我們家住在富世玻士岸。
I am an Truku child.Our family lives in Bsngan.

S.FORM: Rima hiyi ka ruwan sapah mu.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: Niqan tru mnswayi ka sapah nami.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: Niqan tama, bubu, qbsuran mu snaw ni qbsuran mu kuyuh.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: Ttakar bi ka tama mu, knsat qpahun na ka tama mu.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: Hlawax bi ka bubu mu, msapuh qpahun na ka bubu mu.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and she is a doctor.

S.FORM: Tghuy mnan mniq sapah rmngaw kari bubu ka tama mu.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the Truku language with us at home.

S.FORM: Mseupu nami musa alang ka msangay rbagan.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: Tghuy ku mnswayi mu mseupu nami qrak qpatur.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brother and sister and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: Smkuxul ku kingal ruwan sapah mu.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: Musa hmrapas ka bubu mu ni yaku sayang.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: Mgqliyang bi ka karat jiyan, ini ktalux ni ini mskuy ka karat, mtleetu bi ka bgihur.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: Meekan nami bawa mniq babaw spriq, sbu mniq qbubur mu ka hidaw ni muxul balay.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: Babaw kdaaxan da, ppriyux ka karat da.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: Smiling ku bubu mu, hmuya embanah ka karat hug.
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: Rmngaw ka bubu mu, ida bi biyaw miyah ka bgihur paru da.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: Nasi ungat rulung ka keeman do, sriyu ka ppngrah da.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: Mha nami sapah da.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: Musa elug sapah siida o, smulu ku tghuy ppngrah.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: Smulu iya iyah ka bgihur paru, lmnglung ku mlatat musa hmrapas.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: Kiyig bi sapah nami ka ptasan mu, mksa ku musa ptasan kdjiyax, mksa ku miyah sapah uri.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: Aji paru ka ptasan mu, aji hbaraw ka laqi matas, pmkkla nami kana.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: Mseupu nami mssli ngangut ptasan, mseupu nami mrrawa qurug, mseupu nami empprngaw.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: Mdka sapah paru ka ptasan, smksik nami kdjiyax, smksik nami mtbhgay ka ruwan ptasan.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: Smksik nami kdjiyax, smksik nami mtbhgay ka ruwan ptasan.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: Duma seejiq o rmisuh smrus bling rhngun, duma o musa smeeksik.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: Musa nami smksik kana knkingal muhing ptasan. mseupu nami ppdayaw, mtbhgay balay kdjiyax ka ptasan.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: Shiga, mnsa ku alang qmita baki.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: Bsiyaq bi ini nami tqita da, kmdamat ku bi hyaan.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: Qmita knan ka baki o asi ku na pqdali sagas. pmahan ku na qsiya rnabaw.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: Ssibus bi hnuma na sagas ka baki, balay bi malu uqun.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: Mkuxul ku qsiya rnabaw baki uri. malu bi mahan uri.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

S.FORM: Ska hidaw do, mseupu ku payi mhapuy kdeaxan.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: Mhapuy suyang bi kdeaxan ka payi, niqan qsurux, rudux, baun, pngusul uri.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: Babaw mnhdu nami kmjiyax do musa nami qnpahan pajiq kmtuy pajiq.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: Mangal lala bi bunga, sari ni qusul ka payi sbgay na knan adas sapah.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: Mswayay ku dhyaan ni meiyah ku mita dhyaan pxal duri sun mu.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

S.FORM: Sayang o meadas mnan musa rwaan mneudus ka mtgsa. Mniq nami rhngung embkug marig paya.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: Babaw mtmay nami rwaan mneudus do rmngaw ka mtgsa:“ Brah o qqbhni, bukuy o qquyu, lita nanak qmita.”
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: Mngungu ku quyu kika ini ku usa qmita qyquyu.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: Qmita ku lala bi qbhni, ga skkiya babaw qhuni ka dhiya. qmita ku purung ga mtaqi ska rangah qhuni uri.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: Rwaan mneudus o niqan kacing wiwil muhing, kacing mrata/ema ni rklit. Aji ku qmnita ka nnii mneudus. Qtaan sayang do balay bi qrasun wah.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: Lala bi psingal mu ka sasing, Pqtai mu tama ni bubu.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: Pseupu ku tama ni bubu miyah pxal duri.
S.TRANSL: 下次再跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: Jiyax sngayang nii, musa nami qmita swayi snaw tama mu ka qbsuran mu kuyuh ni yaku.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: Paah nami Taipei papa tdruy qrngul musa Taitung.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: Dhuq Taitung do mgriq tdruy miyah smtrung pyaan tdruy mnan ka ririh tama.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: Aji thiyaq bi ka knthyaqan sapah ririh tama ni pyaan tdruy, mgriq cicih tdruy do dhuq da.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: Dalih sapah ririh tama hiya o niqan 1 paru bi tbgan. Mseupu nami peapa tdruy gakat dhuq tbgan.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: Mniq tbgan do madas mnan ka ririh tama tmabug mirit ni peapa ema.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: Keeman do musa nami sbrigan paru alang mkan nhapuy.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: Ska paru alang o lala bi tdruy, kiya ni papa nami tdruy utubay/pupuk musa hiya.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: Mtealax bi siida do, duwa hlayan ka tdruy utubay wada guyun da. Asi nami papa tdruy bahu tealax.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: Miyah nami dhuq Taipei ka sayang da. Ini klai ririh tama gaga na hlayan ka tdruy utubay na dhug.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: Bilaq ku siida o mniq Bsuring ka sapah nami. Babaw matas do musa thjil Teypaq da. Ida mniq meudus alang paru.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在秀林，上學以後，就搬到了台北，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Bsuring. After I started school, we moved to Taipei and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: Babaw matas paru ptasan do smluhay ku 1 iyax tuki quri ptasan knkla kndsan seejiq tnpusu, mkkla ku lala kngklgan seejiq tnpusu Taiwan knsyangan ka knkla kndsan.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: Kiya ni rbagan hngkawas sayang do musa alang qmita smiling rudan ka qbsuran mu snaw ni yaku. Kmklaun nami nanak ka knklgan seejiq knkla kndsan ta.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: Wada maspat kmxalan hngkwasan na ka rudan da, kiya ni mdka saw mgska knrudan seejiq qtaan.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: Smiling ku hyaan mnmanu kari ka klaun na, mkla bi rmngaw kari Truku ka hiya. mkla kari Tayal, kari Ngayngay ni kari Nihung.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的太魯閣族語說得很流利，也會說泰雅語、客家話和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Truku, as well as Atayal, Hakka and Japanese.

S.FORM: Smnilng ku hyaan do hana ku mkla, kla sa paah laqi do smluhay kari Nihung da. Kuyuh na o seejiq Tayal. Kiya ni qnpahan na o mgkla lala bi seejiq Ngangay, kika saw nii mkla rmngaw lala knlgan kari.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是泰雅族人，而他工作上認識許多客家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Atayal, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: Empprngaw nami ssida do lala bi rnngaw na quri knkla knxalan maduk ka rudan.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: Ana nami ini qhdui mkla embahang, kiya ni spowda nami nngalan nami sasaw qnawal baga, mtduwa tgluus embahang duri.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: Bilaq ku siida ini ku kla knkla kndsan seejiq ta nanak, ita nanak ka saw seejiq tnpusu o niqan cicih saw smsiqa kida.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: Rinah lala klaun ta do, rina tgkla ita nanak ka seejiq Truku o maa kingal bi nanak ni balay bi tdhuun uri.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為太魯閣族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Truku is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: Gbiyan sayang, meiyah sapah ka swayi mu snaw da.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: Musa marig rudux sbrigan ka payi ni yaku, ppsramal mhapuy uuqun swayi mu snaw nhapuy gbiyan.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: Muda nami sbrigan damat, lala bi bgurah mgpajiq pajiq ka sbrigan damat.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: Marig nami wahir bunga, lnbay ni tbihi banah.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: Rmngaw ka tnpusu sbrigan hiyi qhuni, “Ssibus bi ka kalat ni qlupas mu. brigi cicih wah!” msa.
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: Mnarig nami kalat ni qlupas ka yami.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: Muda nami sbrigan hiyi, rmngaw ka tnpusu, embarig namu manu? Paru ni mtbnaw bi ka rudux sayang, kingal o 300 kbkuy pila.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: Suqi bi knkrayan da msa lmnglung ka payi. Slingan na ka tnpusu ini tduwa mhnuk cicih sun na.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: Kiya ni rmngaw ka tnpusu mhnuk bi ka kida, ini tduwa mhnuk da.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: Rmngaw ka kiyig tnpusu, iyah marig qsurux mu, paru ni mhnuk bi ka qsurux mu.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: Tghici bi do marig nami rudux ni marig qsurux uri. Saan mhapuy sapah kingal tluan ka damat.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: Bsiyaq bi tnegaan, mkuung ka karat da.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: Miyah qnawal na ka swayi mu snaw rmngaw asi lu ini tduwa msangay ka qpuring mrata da ni empxal jiyax sngayan do kika mtduwa miyah da msa.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: Rmngaw ka payi mnhapuy saw nii knlala, plwaani kana iyah supu mkan wah!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

S.FORM: Mlawa nami lplupung dlutut, mseupu tblaiq mkan knsyangan uqan gbiyan.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: Niqan kingal tnhiyan mu matas hangan na o Yakaw, smhungi bi madas qaya kdjiyax.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Yakaw，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Yakaw, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: Matas bi siida, kmsiyuk ppatas, ssrus aji o ptasun patas tnhiyan na.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: Empxal, mndha, mntru, pksiyuk bi qaya hyaan kana.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: Kiya ni niqan kingal naqih lnhayan na. Kmsiyuk qaya do ini bgay.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: Hici bi do ini pksiyuk qaya hyaan kana da.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: Niqan kingal jiyax, musa nami msupu mrrawa ngangut.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: muda elug kmusa bi ngangut ka Yakaw, kiya ni smhungi madas lblak ssrus.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Yakaw想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Yakaw wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: mksiyuk tnhiyan na lblak ssrus, kiya ni smiyuk hyaan kana ini ku adas yaku uri msa smiyuk rmngaw.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: Mtbiyax bi ka Yakaw ni lmingis da. Msaang rmngaw, hmuya ma namu ini pksiyuk lblak ssrus knan!
S.TRANSL: Yakaw急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!
Yakaw burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: Smiyuk hyaan ka tnhiyan na. Yasa ini su bi adas nanak ka isu, duri ni knsyukan su ka qaya o ini su bqaani!
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: Saw saman musa ptasan, mgrbu bi dhuq ptasan ka Yakaw. Ngali na ka knsyukan na tnhiyan na ka qyqaya o bqaani na tnhiyan na kana.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Yakaw很早就到學校了，Yakaw把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Yakaw arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: Psruwa tnhiyan na ka Yakaw ni rmngaw, babaw na do ida ku bi meadas qaya mu nanak, mhuway namu balay brah na o smruwa namu pksiyuk qaya hyaan uri.
S.TRANSL: Yakaw向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Yakaw apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: Emptsamat alang ka tama mu.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: Bilaq ku siida, mlatat keeman ka nirih mu tama ni tama, madas pucing ni puniq.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: Rmdax karat do madas nbuan dha samat miyah da.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: Duma o bowyak, duma o rapit, msuwil niqan glaqung uri.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: Mniq rhngung alang sgun na ka samat ni seasug dha sjiqun.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: Stnxay skribug ku tama mu kdjiyax, mkmusa ku sneegul tama maduk.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: Rmngaw ka tama, paru su do dsun ku na supu maduk da.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: Mkla dmuuuy qlubung qmrak samat uri ka snaw alang, mkla smmalu waya qlubung ni dangar btunux.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: Mkla bi qmlubung gasil ka tama mu, rmngaw ka tama, nii o qrak glaqung kiya, tgluus ta bi qmita ka dapil papak endaan samat. Psaan ta elug uuda samat ka qlubung.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: Iiyux ku nhari mseupu rudan musa maduk, smluhay ku qmlubung kdjiyax. Ini bi biyaw balay bi mtduwa qmrak samat ka qlubung mu da.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: Babaw qmnita ku tama rmngaw knan hici o ida su mha maa malu bi emptsamat.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: Sayang paru ku da, mapa ku bhniq ni buji mu, mseupu ku tama musa maduk.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: Miyah alang do ngalun nami ka snbu nami samat sseasug nami seejiq ta.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: Rmngaw ka tama, qrasan ta bi ka utux rudan smblaiq mgay saw nii lala bi nngalan ta samat.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: Mqsuqi ku musa ptasan ka mgrbu da .
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: Musa ptasan siida , smhungi ku madas aba patas .
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: Ini ku adas ana manu .
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn’t bring anything with me.

S.FORM: Matas siida , seupu ku tnhiyan mu matas qmita patas .
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: Pspung matas siida , pksyukan kuna ppatas ni ssrus ka tnhiyan mu matas .
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: Rngagan kuna ka mtgsa , “ babaw na do tutuy nhari , iya pqsuqi da ! ”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, “Wake up earlier next time and don’t be late again!”

S.FORM: Malu bi lupung mu o Watan , laqi Truku ka hiya uri .
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Watan，他也是太魯閣族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Watan, and he is also an Truku child.

S.FORM: Seupu nami matas mniq alang Kdusan .
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在Kdusan部落讀書。
We study together in the Kdusan tribe.

S.FORM: Seupu nami embahang rudan rmngaw endaan sbiyaw kdjiyax , mkla nami bi rmngaw kari Truku .
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說太魯閣語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Truku proficiently.

S.FORM: Takar ni mtbnaw ku bi , llbu ni hlawax bi ka Watan .
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Watan很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Watan is short and thin.

S.FORM: Mpplaq bi ka Watan , smkuxul bi hyaan kana .
S.TRANSL: Watan很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Watan is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: Jiyax psslian tmalang ptasan ka sayang, muda lala bi psdka ka ptasan.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: Niqan brbil gasil, qurug btragan qaqay, tmalang, rmgrig ni pstalang buji.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: Psdka ku tmalang ka yaku.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: Pklug ku tmalang siida, mtakur ku da, sdara bi ka bqlit.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: Kiya ni mhiyug ku, ida ku mquri brah tmalang.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: Dhuq ku nhdaan siida, mqaras bi kana ka seejiq.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: Ana ku ini angal tgbrah hangan, ida ku mqaras balay, yaasa mnhdu ku psdka da.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: Yaku ni tama mu o musa nami qmita nirih tama mu ka shiga.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: Mluqih ka qaqay nirih tama da.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: Rngagan nami na, empruq kingal bling ka dnamux sapah.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: Pklug smmalu dnamux ka hiya siida ga, mtucing pnaah dnamux da.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: Madas hiyi kacing ni sbiki ka tama sbgay na nirih tama.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: Empprngaw nami ruwan sapah ka yaku ni nirih tama, seasug kuna rmngaw lala bi endaan na.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: Mmowsa ku siida, tmdahu knan ka nirih tama, wada ku maaparu ni mtradaw bi uri da.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: Rngagan mu, “Tgai saw malu ka qaqay su da o iyah tuhuy sapah nami uri.”
S.TRANSL: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」
I said, “When your foot gets better, come to our house next time and visit us.”

S.FORM: Hngkawas empusal kbkuy empusal dha siida, mnda emprngaw ka Klwaan tduwa powsa hangan kari ta nanak ka patas hnyigan Seejiq Tnpusu.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: Smniling ku risaw alang Umin Peydang, hiya o bsiyaq balay gmspung patas hnyigan “powsa hangan kari ta nanak” mquri Klwaan.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Umin Peydang。
I interviewed Umin Peydang, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: Mnhdu nami empprngaw, jiyax sngayan nii mowsa sapah na smiling hyaan.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: Kska Sniling mu siida, pgkla knan pnyahan hangan na, dsun kuna pgkla kingal ruwan sapah na ni alang na uri.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: Smiling ku hyaan, hmuya ma su saw ida gigit priyux hangan, uda powsa patas seuxal o naqih hug?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: Rngagan kuna, yaasa dmuuy kari Cyukuku o ini psleexan balay pgkla hangan na, duma seejiq “烏先生” msa mlawa hyaan uri, kiya ni saw bi smhulis.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Wu Xian Sheng

S.FORM: Rmngaw ka Umin Peydang, “Hangan pnatas kari Seejiq Tnpusu o kika balay bi hangan ta. Hangan mu o pgkla klgan seejiq ta, pnswayan sapah ta, hnyigan ta, tai saw emphbaraw balay ka seejiq dhuq hmlay hangan dha nanak.”
S.TRANSL: our family
Umin Peydang said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: Shiga o musa sbrigan smbarig ka yaku ni payi, madas lala bi pajiq nhuma na nanak ka payi, smmalu uqun Seejiq Tnpusu uri biqan na ana ima.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: Smkuxul bi sbrigan payi ka kana seejiq, hbaraw bi seejiq marig usik ni sruhing, hbaraw seejiq miyah mkan nhapuy hnpuyan na.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和山蘇很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and Nest fern, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: Rmala ni butul hnpuyan na o malu balay uqan, niqan muduh hiyi bowyak uri, knshiya na hmgut hbaraw lupung mniyah, miyah embkug sbrigan nami kana.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的過貓和糯米飯非常好吃，還有烤山豬肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: Mhapuy siida ka payi, kmeaguh ku lupung mniyah kiyig ka yaku, mlawa ku kiyig hiya, “Hmaan mu nanak kana ka pajiq, ini rusi sapuh, iyah marig nhari!”
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮東西的時候，我在旁邊招攬客人。我在一旁大喊著：「蔬菜都是自己種的，天然有機，趕快來買喔!」
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, “The vegetables are self-grown, all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!”

S.FORM: Aji biyaw qhduun smbarig kana ka qngqaya nami da. “Nuxay bi dnyagan su.” msa ka payi.
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了。奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, “It’s all thanks to your help.”

S.FORM: Euda nii, wada ku smluhay pnegluban quri knkla pnhmaan ni uqun Seejiq Tnpusu, duri ni knrbkan muda smbarig.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: Qmita ku payi smkuxul bi uqun nrudan, smparu ni mqaras bi lnglungan mu.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
